page.title: 13 Blackheath village library
page.content: The village library is situated in Tranquil Passage.The building is over 100 years old & was built as a village school.It was bought in 1950 by Lewis- ham Borough Council for use as a library.It has an adult & children section.It possesses 16700 books.There are 5500 in the childrens depart. & 200 reference books. The busiest days for the 3 librarians are Thursdays & Saturdays. Most popular books are those that have been reviewed recently in the national papers and those written by Jeffrey Archer. Children enjoy adventure and ghost stories.Roald Dahl and Alfred Hitchcock are their favourite authors. The Encyclopaedia Britannica is the most valuable set of books and cost one thousand pounds.
